column4: i have a intrepid install that was working beautifully...then yesterday i powerdown to move it to its permanant living quarters...now when i power up it get "boot from (hd0,0) ext *UUID#'s*
then it says "Starting up ..." and it never loads
Are you *sure* it is using the right UUID(s)?
are you in a live session on that machine?
i can get a grub prompt yes
also, what do you mean by "move it to its permanent living quarters"?
instead of beside my desk it goes into a closet
that's not a live session, but I think you can still get the uuids from there... let me remember how
i sure hope so..it might take an hour to get a live cd booted..the cdrom on this thing sucks
if you type help is there a uuid command?
yes..it says "uuid UUID"
experiment with that? It should be able to print out the uuids for your system (but I'm not sure how easy it'll be to tell which one you should be booting from)
if need be, you can just have it search for stage2 on each uuid in turn :\
UUID's match...
k, remind me where it gets stuck while booting?
I had that problem once, but give me a moment to see if I can remember what I did to fix it... (I could have sworn it was messed up uuids) :\
Have you tried dropping to grub prompt and manaully booting it?
same thing....it really acts like a kernel problem but i have no idea how to get into it ot fix it
doesn't sound like a kernel problem to me... you'll normally get good error info for those
So, when you try to boot manually, what happens?
it says the same thing as if it were to boot on its own, "Boot from (hd0,0) ext3 *UIDD*                               Starting up ...."
Sorry, I don't know what the problem is :(
is there any other options that i can do with a live cd?
you could look at your menu.lst and/or /etc/fstab
